This ensures that you still have access and can update a policy if a change is required. Please review the affected users and apps.\n+> Don't lock yourself out! We recommend applying a policy to a small set of users first to verify it behaves as expected. We also recommend excluding at least one admin from this policy. This ensures that you still have access and can update a policy if a change is required. Please review the affected users and apps.\n \n-By default the policy provides an option to exclude the current user from the policy, but an administrator can override as shown in the following image. \n+By default, the policy provides an option to exclude the current user, but an admin can override it as shown in the following image. \n \n ![Warning, don't lock yourself out!](./media/concept-conditional-access-users-groups/conditional-access-users-and-groups-lockout-warning.png)\n \n-If you do find yourself locked out, see [What to do if you're locked out?](troubleshoot-conditional-access.md#what-to-do-if-youre-locked-out)\n+If you find yourself locked out, see [What to do if you're locked out?](troubleshoot-conditional-access.md#what-to-do-if-youre-locked-out).\n \n ### External partner access\n \n-Conditional Access policies that target external users might interfere with service provider access, for example granular delegated admin privileges [Introduction to granular delegated admin privileges (GDAP)](/partner-center/gdap-introduction). For policies that are intended to target service provider tenants, use the **Service provider user** external user type available in the **Guest or external users** selection options.\n+Conditional Access policies that target external users might interfere with service provider access, such as granular delegated admin privileges. Learn more in [Introduction to granular delegated admin privileges (GDAP)](/partner-center/gdap-introduction). For policies that are intended to target service provider tenants, use the **Service provider user** external user type available in the **Guest or external users** selection options.\n \n ## Workload identities \n "

    "patch": "@@ -1,11 +1,11 @@\n ---\n-title: What is Conditional Access in Microsoft Entra ID?\n-description: Conditional Access is the Zero Trust policy engine at the heart of the new identity-driven control plane.\n+title: \"Microsoft Entra Conditional Access: Zero Trust Policy Engine\"\n+description: Explore Microsoft Entra Conditional Access, the Zero Trust policy engine that integrates signals to secure access to resources.\n \n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: conditional-access\n ms.topic: overview\n-ms.date: 07/01/2025\n+ms.date: 09/23/2025\n \n ms.author: joflore\n author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n@@ -20,53 +20,52 @@ Modern security extends beyond an organization's network perimeter to include us\n \n Conditional Access policies at their simplest are if-then statements; **if** a user wants to access a resource, **then** they must complete an action. For example: If a user wants to access an application or service like Microsoft 365, then they must perform multifactor authentication to gain access.\n \n-Administrators are faced with two primary goals:\n+Admins are faced with two primary goals:\n \n - Empower users to be productive wherever and whenever\n - Protect the organization's assets\n \n Use Conditional Access policies to apply the right access controls when needed to keep your organization secure.\n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n-> Conditional Access policies are enforced after first-factor authentication is completed. Conditional Access isn't intended to be an organization's first line of defense for scenarios like denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, but it can use signals from these events to determine access.\n+> Conditional Access policies are enforced after first-factor authentication is completed. Conditional Access isn't intended to be an organization's frontline of defense for scenarios like denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, but it can use signals from these events to determine access.\n \n ## Common signals\n \n-Conditional Access takes signals from various sources into account when making access decisions. \n+Conditional Access uses signals from various sources to make access decisions. \n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/overview/conditional-access-central-policy-engine-zero-trust.png\" alt-text=\"Diagram that shows Conditional Access as the Zero Trust policy engine aggregating signals from various sources.\":::\n \n These signals include:\n \n - User or group membership\n-   - Policies can be targeted to specific users and groups giving administrators fine-grained control over access.\n+   - Policies can be targeted to specific users and groups giving admins fine-grained control over access.\n - IP Location information\n    - Organizations can create trusted IP address ranges that can be used when making policy decisions. \n-   - Administrators can specify entire countries or regions IP ranges to block or allow traffic from.\n+   - Admins can specify entire countries or regions IP ranges to block or allow traffic from.\n - Device\n    - Users with devices of specific platforms or marked with a specific state can be used when enforcing Conditional Access policies.\n    - Use filters for devices to target policies to specific devices like privileged access workstations.\n - Application\n-   - Users attempting to access specific applications can trigger different Conditional Access policies.\n+   - Trigger different Conditional Access policies when users attempt to access specific applications.\n - Real-time and calculated risk detection\n-   - Signals integration with [Microsoft Entra ID Protection](~/id-protection/overview-identity-protection.md) lets Conditional Access policies identify and remediate risky users and sign-in behavior.\n+   - Integrate signals from [Microsoft Entra ID Protection](~/id-protection/overview-identity-protection.md) to identify and remediate risky users and sign-in behavior.\n - [Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps](/defender-cloud-apps/what-is-defender-for-cloud-apps)\n-   - Lets user application access and sessions be monitored and controlled in real time. This integration increases visibility and control over access to and activities done within your cloud environment.\n+   - Monitor and control user application access and sessions in real time. This integration improves visibility and control over access and activities in your cloud environment.\n \n ## Common decisions\n \n-- Block access\n-   - Most restrictive decision\n-- Grant access\n-- Less restrictive decision that can require one or more of the following options:\n-   - Require multifactor authentication\n-   - Require authentication strength\n-   - Require device to be marked as compliant\n-   - Require Microsoft Entra hybrid joined device\n-   - Require approved client app\n-   - Require app protection policy\n-   - Require password change\n-   - Require terms of use\n+- Block access is the most restrictive decision.\n+- Grant access.\n+- A less restrictive decision that might require one or more of the following options:\n+   - Require multifactor authentication.\n+   - Require authentication strength.\n+   - Require the device to be marked as compliant.\n+   - Require a Microsoft Entra hybrid joined device.\n+   - Require an approved client app.\n+   - Require an app protection policy.\n+   - Require a password change.\n+   - Require terms of use.\n \n ## Commonly applied policies\n \n@@ -80,43 +79,42 @@ Many organizations have [common access concerns that Conditional Access policies\n - Blocking risky sign-in behaviors\n - Requiring organization-managed devices for specific applications\n \n-Admins can create policies from scratch of the Conditional Access overview page.\" lightbox=\"media/overview/conditional-access-overview.png\":::\n \n-- The **Overview** page provides a summary of policy state, users, devices, and This filtering ability lets admins find specific policies based on their configuration quickly.\n \n ### Conditional Access optimization agent\n \n-The [Conditional Access optimization agent](agent-optimization.md) (preview) with Microsoft Security Copilot recommends new policies and changes to existing policies based on Zero Trust principles and Microsoft best practices. The agent requires at least the Microsoft Entra ID P1 license and [security compute units (SCU)](/copilot/security/manage-usage).\n+The [Conditional Access optimization agent](agent-optimization.md) (preview) with Microsoft Security Copilot suggests new policies and changes to existing ones based on Zero Trust principles and Microsoft best practices. With one click, apply the suggestion to automatically update or create a Conditional Access policy. The agent needs at least the Microsoft Entra ID P1 license and [security compute units (SCU)](/copilot/security/manage-usage).\n \n ## License requirements\n \n [!INCLUDE [Active Directory P1 license](~/includes/entra-p1-license.md)]\n \n-Customers with [Microsoft 365 Business Premium licenses](/office365/servicedescriptions/office-365-service-descriptions-technet-library) also have access to Conditional Access features.\n-\n-Risk-based policies require access to [Microsoft Entra ID Protection](~/id-protection/overview-identity-protection.md), which requires P2 licenses.\n+Customers with [Microsoft 365 Business Premium licenses](/office365/servicedescriptions/office-365-service-descriptions-technet-library) can also use Conditional Access features.\n \n-Other products and features that interact with Conditional Access policies require appropriate licensing for those products and features.\n+Other products and features that interact with Conditional Access policies require appropriate licensing for those products and features. This includes Microsoft Entra Workload ID, Microsoft Entra ID Protection, and Microsoft Purview.\n \n-When licenses required for Conditional Access expire, policies aren't automatically disabled or deleted. This lets customers migrate away from Conditional Access policies without a sudden change in their security posture. Remaining policies can be viewed and deleted, but no longer updated.\n+When the licenses required for Conditional Access expire, policies aren't automatically disabled or deleted. This graceful state lets customers migrate away from Conditional Access policies without a sudden change in their security posture. You can view and delete remaining policies, but you can't update them.\n \n [Security defaults](~/fundamentals/security-defaults.md) help protect against identity-related attacks and are available for all customers.  \n \n [!INCLUDE [active-directory-zero-trust](~/includes/entra-zero-trust.md)]\n \n ## Next steps\n \n-- [Building a Conditional Access policy piece by piece](concept-conditional-access-policies.md)\n - [Plan your Conditional Access deployment](plan-conditional-access.md)"

ai_summary.Response: These commits primarily involve updates to Microsoft Entra ID documentation. Several articles related to Conditional Access policies have been revised to clarify terminology, improve descriptions, and ensure grammatical accuracy, including sections on network conditions, target resources, grant controls, session controls, users/groups, and general overviews. Additionally, there are updates to the Netkope coexistence documentation and the configuration of application management policies.

ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the documentation for configuring Netskope coexistence with Microsoft Entra Global Secure Access. The changes focus on simplifying the steering configuration for private apps within the Netskope portal. Specifically, it removes detailed instructions for internet access steering and instead directs users to select 'All Private Apps' for Netskope to steer. It also removes the extensive list of domain exceptions, implying a more streamlined approach to exception handling.

ai_summary.Response: This commit makes several documentation updates. Primarily, it refines the ordering of security controls within the Global Secure Access documentation and updates the navigation paths and image references for Microsoft Entra Connect Cloud Sync, including a new image for the cloud sync configurations. Additionally, it clarifies instructions for downloading authentication scripts and updates author and date metadata across several include files.

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation for Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensing for guest users, clarifying the billing for Access Reviews and modifying the `ms.date` field. It also enhances the troubleshooting guide for macOS Platform Single Sign-On extension by reorganising and adding information about TLS inspection exclusions for registration and token acquisition flows.

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/bf664caeb593b271e58b1a14273baed9f0b5dcf2/docs%2Fid-governance%2Freprocess-workflow.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Freprocess-workflow.md?ref=bf664caeb593b271e58b1a14273baed9f0b5dcf2",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@\n+---\n+title: Reprocess workflow runs using Lifecycle Workflows (Preview)\n+description: This article guides a user on reprocessing workflow runs using Lifecycle Workflows\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.subservice: lifecycle-workflows\n+ms.topic: how-to #Required; leave this attribute/value as-is\n+ms.date: 09/06/2025\n+\n+#CustomerIntent: As a Lifecycle Workflow Administrator, I want to reprocess workflow runs so that I can quickly re-run workflows that may have failed.\n+---\n+\n+# Reprocess workflow runs using Lifecycle Workflows (Preview)\n+\n+Reprocessing workflows is a feature that allows workflows created using lifecycle workflows to be run again to ensure workflows operate as intended. This is useful when dealing with runs that failed for some reason. This article provides step-by-step instructions for reprocessing workflows using the Microsoft Entra admin center, enabling you to quickly and efficiently manage workflow runs for users or specific runs.\n+\n+\n+## Reprocess a workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center\n+\n+\n+To reprocess a workflow using the Microsoft Entra admin center, you do the following steps:\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+\n+1. On the workflow list screen, select the workflow you want to reprocess.\n+\n+1. On the workflow overview page, select **Workflow history**.\n+\n+1. On the workflow history screen, the **Users** tab is automatically open, allowing you to see a list of users processed by the workflow.\n+\n+1. To reprocess a workflow for a user, select the user you want to reprocess a workflow for, and select **Reprocess**. \n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/reprocess-workflow/reprocess-workflow.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of reprocessing a workflow.\":::\n+    > [!NOTE]\n+    > You're able to reprocess up to 10 users at a time.\n+1. If you want to reprocess a workflow based on a run, select the **Runs** tab.\n+\n+1. In the runs tab, you're able to see a full list of workflow runs. Select the run you want to reprocess and select **Reprocess**. \n+    > [!NOTE]\n+    > Only a single run can be reprocessed at a time.\n+\n+\n+\n+## Next steps\n+\n+- [Lifecycle Workflows history](lifecycle-workflow-history.md)\n+- [Auditing Lifecycle Workflows](lifecycle-workflow-audits.md)\n+\n+\n+\n+\n+"
  },

    "patch": "@@ -148,6 +148,8 @@ For joined devices to Microsoft Entra ID:\n - If the [Web sign-in](/windows/client-management/mdm/policy-csp-authentication#authentication-enablewebsignin) feature on Windows is also enabled, the user can use TAP to sign into the device. This is intended only for completing initial device setup, or recovery when the user doesn't know or have a password. \n \n For hybrid-joined devices, users must first authenticate with another method such as a password, smartcard or FIDO2 key, before using TAP to set up Windows Hello for Business. \n+> [!NOTE]\n+> For federated domains, the **FederatedIdpMfaBehavior** changes the behavior when MFA is required. If set to **enforceMfaByFederatedIdp** the user is redirected to the federated IDP and does not get the chance to use the TAP. However, if set to **acceptIfMfaDoneByFederatedIdp** then the user will see a TAP prompt in Entra ID during MFA for Windows Hello for Business provisioning.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n > For federated domains where federatedIdpMfaBehavior is set to enforceMfaByFederatedIdp, users will not be prompted for TAP to satisfy multifactor authentication (MFA) to set up Windows Hello for Business. Instead, they are redirected to the federated Identity Provider (IdP) for multifactor authentication (MFA)."
  },

    "patch": "@@ -86,7 +86,7 @@ If the agent suggests modifying an existing policy, select **Review policy chang\n - Policy details are provided as both a list of all the details that are changing and a JSON view of the entire policy, with the changes highlighted.\n - For policy changes that affect users or applications, you can download a JSON file of the users and applications affected by the policy change.\n \n-### Deep analysis (Preview)\n+### Deep analysis\n \n Deep analysis performs an in-depth review of Conditional Access policies for scenarios such as blocking legacy authentication, blocking device control flow, and policies that require device or MFA controls. It evaluates the targeted users, groups, and roles to identify coverage gaps, overlapping or redundant policies, and consolidation opportunities. It also analyzes exclusions—flagging policies that exclude a large portion of users and recommending explicit exclusion of break‑glass accounts to reduce the risk of accidental lockout.\n "

    "patch": "@@ -12,12 +12,26 @@ This article lists the versions and features of Microsoft Entra provisioning age\n \n ## Download link\n \n-From the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_Connect_Provisioning/AADConnectMenuBlade/~/GetStarted), select \"Cloud Sync\" and go to \"Agents\" to download the \"Provisioning Agent.\"\n+From the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_Connect_Provisioning/AADConnectMenuBlade/~/GetStarted), select **Cloud Sync**, and go to **Agents** to download the **Provisioning Agent**.\n \n Get notified about when to revisit this page for updates by copying and pasting this URL: `https://aka.ms/cloudsyncrss` into your ![RSS feed reader icon](media/cloud-sync-version-history/feed-icon-16-x-16.png) feed reader.\n \n \n+## 1.1.2102.0\n \n+Sept 22, 2025: released for download only\n+\n+### Fixed issues\n+\n+- Improved reliability of agent install and upgrade by preventing service timeouts\n+- Streamlined how to enable Windows Credential Manager during agent installation\n+- Added a check for the Hybrid Administrator role prerequisite, and activate the role for eligible authenticated users\n+- Simplified how to choose your provisioning scenario\n+- Configured installation for the current cloud environment by default\n+- Faster enumeration for large groups by preventing service timeouts\n+- Improved sync reliability with a registry entry named **RegistryValueNameUserPasswordLength** to configure user password length\n+- Improved how admins can view their domain controller priority list\n+- Added UserAccountControl as a System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) property\n \n \n ## 1.1.1586.0\n@@ -214,7 +228,7 @@ January 20, 2021: released for download only\n ### Fixed issues\n -\tPrevent quarantine when scoping group is out of scope\n -\tPHS job now only operates for in-scope users, when scoping filters are configured\n--\tAgent would sometime stop responding during upgrade\n+-\tAgent would sometimes stop responding during upgrade\n -\tInitial Sync for objects in nested OUs when using OU scoping\n -\tMake the Repair-AADCloudSyncToolsAccount more robust\n -\tReduce large memory usage of OU scoping filters"
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/bf664caeb593b271e58b1a14273baed9f0b5dcf2/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-cloud-sync-how-to-install.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/bf664caeb593b271e58b1a14273baed9f0b5dcf2/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-cloud-sync-how-to-install.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-cloud-sync-how-to-install.md?ref=bf664caeb593b271e58b1a14273baed9f0b5dcf2",
    "patch": "@@ -1,71 +1,59 @@\n ---\n title: Include file\n description: Include file\n-author: billmath\n+author: omondiatieno\n+manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n-ms.topic: include\n-ms.date: 11/11/2022\n-ms.author: billmath\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 09/22/2025\n+ms.subservice: hybrid-cloud-sync\n+ms.author: jomondi\n ms.custom: include file, sfi-image-nochange\n ---\n \n- 1. In the Azure portal, select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n- 1. On the left pane, select **Microsoft Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n+1. In the Azure portal, select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n+1. On the left pane, select **Microsoft Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Get started screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Get started screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\":::\n \n- 1. On the left pane, select **Agents**.\n- 1. Select **Download on-premises agent**, and then select **Accept terms & download**.\n+1. On the left pane, select **Agents**.\n+1. Select **Download on-premises agent**, and then select **Accept terms & download**.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows downloading the agent.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows downloading the agent.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\":::\n \n- 1. After you download the Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent Package, run the *AADConnectProvisioningAgentSetup.exe* installation file from your downloads folder.\n+1. After you download the Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent Package, run the *AADConnectProvisioningAgentSetup.exe* installation file from your downloads folder.\n \n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > When you perform an installation for the US Government Cloud, use *AADConnectProvisioningAgentSetup.exe ENVIRONMENTNAME=AzureUSGovernment*. For more information, see [Install an agent in the US Government Cloud](~/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/how-to-install.md#install-an-agent-in-the-us-government-cloud).\n+1. On the screen that opens, select the **I agree to the license terms and conditions** checkbox, and then select **Install**.\n \n- 1. On the screen that opens, select the **I agree to the license terms and conditions** checkbox, and then select **Install**.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/agree-license-terms.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Microsoft Entra Provisioning Agent Package licensing terms.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/agree-license-terms.png\":::\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-splash-screen.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Microsoft Entra Provisioning Agent Package screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\":::\n+1. After the installation finishes, the configuration wizard opens. Select **Next** to start the configuration.\n \n- 1. After the installation finishes, the configuration wizard opens. Select **Next** to start the configuration.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/welcome.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the welcome screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/welcome.png\":::\n+   \n+1. Sign in with an account with at least the [Hybrid Identity administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#hybrid-identity-administrator) role. If you have Internet Explorer enhanced security enabled, it blocks the sign-in. If so, close the installation, [disable Internet Explorer enhanced security](/troubleshoot/developer/browsers/security-privacy/enhanced-security-configuration-faq), and restart the Microsoft Entra Provisioning Agent Package installation.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-3.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the welcome screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-3.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/username.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Connect Microsoft Entra ID screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/username.png\":::\n \n- 1. On the **Select Extension** screen, select **HR-driven provisioning (Workday and SuccessFactors) / Azure AD Connect Cloud Sync**, and then select **Next**.\n+1. On the **Configure Service Account** screen, select a group Managed Service Account (gMSA). This account is used to run the agent service. If a managed service account is already configured in your domain by another agent and you're installing a second agent, select **Create gMSA**. The system detects the existing account and adds the required permissions for the new agent to use the gMSA account. When you're prompted, choose one of two options:\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-5.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Select Extension screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-5.png\":::\n+   - **Create gMSA**: Let the agent create the **provAgentgMSA$** managed service account for you. The group managed service account (for example, `CONTOSO\\provAgentgMSA$`) is created in the same Active Directory domain where the host server joined. To use this option, enter the Active Directory domain administrator credentials (recommended).\n+   - **Use custom gMSA**: Provide the name of the managed service account that you manually created for this task.\n \n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > If you install the provisioning agent for use with [Microsoft Entra on-premises application provisioning](~/identity/app-provisioning/on-premises-application-provisioning-architecture.md), select **On-premises application provisioning (Microsoft Entra ID to application)**.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows how to configure the group Managed Service Account.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\":::\n \n- 1. Sign in with an account with at least the [Hybrid Identity administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#hybrid-identity-administrator) role. If you have Internet Explorer enhanced security enabled, it blocks the sign-in. If so, close the installation, [disable Internet Explorer enhanced security](/troubleshoot/developer/browsers/security-privacy/enhanced-security-configuration-faq), and restart the Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent Package installation.\n+1. To continue, select **Next**.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-azure.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Connect Microsoft Entra ID screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-azure.png\":::\n+1. On the **Connect Active Directory** screen, if your domain name appears under **Configured domains**, skip to the next step. Otherwise, enter your Active Directory domain name, and select **Add directory**.\n \n- 1. On the **Configure Service Account** screen, select a group Managed Service Account (gMSA). This account is used to run the agent service. If a managed service account is already configured in your domain by another agent and you're installing a second agent, select **Create gMSA**. The system detects the existing account and adds the required permissions for the new agent to use the gMSA account. When you're prompted, choose one of two options:\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows configured domains.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\":::\n \n-    - **Create gMSA**: Let the agent create the **provAgentgMSA$** managed service account for you. The group managed service account (for example, `CONTOSO\\provAgentgMSA$`) is created in the same Active Directory domain where the host server joined. To use this option, enter the Active Directory domain administrator credentials (recommended).\n-    - **Use custom gMSA**: Provide the name of the managed service account that you manually created for this task.\n+1. Sign in with your Active Directory domain administrator account. The domain administrator account shouldn't have an expired password. If the password is expired or changes during the agent installation, reconfigure the agent with the new credentials. This operation adds your on-premises directory. Select **OK**, and then select **Next** to continue.\n \n- 1. To continue, select **Next**.\n+1. Select **Next** to continue.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Configure Service Account screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\":::\n+1. On the **Configuration complete** screen, select **Confirm**. This operation registers and restarts the agent.\n \n- 1. On the **Connect Active Directory** screen, if your domain name appears under **Configured domains**, skip to the next step. Otherwise, enter your Active Directory domain name, and select **Add directory**.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/finish.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the finish screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/finish.png\":::\n \n- 1. Sign in with your Active Directory domain administrator account. The domain administrator account shouldn't have an expired password. If the password is expired or changes during the agent installation, reconfigure the agent with the new credentials. This operation adds your on-premises directory. Select **OK**, and then select **Next** to continue.\n-\n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-entra.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows how to enter the domain admin credentials.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-entra.png\":::\n-\n- 1. The following screenshot shows an example of the domain configured for contoso.com. Select **Next** to continue.\n-\n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Connect Active Directory screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\":::\n-\n- 1. On the **Configuration complete** screen, select **Confirm**. This operation registers and restarts the agent.\n-\n- 1. After the operation finishes, you see a notification that your agent configuration was successfully verified. Select **Exit**.\n-\n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-confirm-screen.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the finish screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-confirm-screen.png\":::\n-\n- 1. If you still get the initial screen, select **Close**.\n+1. After the operation finishes, you see a notification that your agent configuration was successfully verified. Select **Exit**. If you still get the initial screen, select **Close**."
  },

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates Microsoft Entra documentation with several enhancements. A new topic on reprocessing workflow runs in Lifecycle Workflows has been added, along with updates to existing documentation concerning Global Secure Access, FIDO2 security key vendors, Temporary Access Pass usage with federated domains, Conditional Access policy analysis, macOS Kerberos SSO configuration, Cloud Sync agent installation procedures (including US government cloud deployments), and dynamic group membership rules. Minor corrections to wording and formatting have also been implemented across various documents.

changes.author: Dennis Rea
changes.message:
Merge pull request #9732 from Justinha/provisioning-agent-installation

Update Entra Cloud Sync install guide and images

    "patch": "@@ -1,68 +1,59 @@\n ---\n title: Include file\n description: Include file\n-author: billmath\n+author: omondiatieno\n+manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n-ms.topic: include\n-ms.date: 11/11/2022\n-ms.author: billmath\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 09/22/2025\n+ms.subservice: hybrid-cloud-sync\n+ms.author: jomondi\n ms.custom: include file, sfi-image-nochange\n ---\n \n- 1. In the Azure portal, select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n- 1. On the left pane, select **Microsoft Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n+1. In the Azure portal, select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n+1. On the left pane, select **Microsoft Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Get started screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Get started screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\":::\n \n- 1. On the left pane, select **Agents**.\n- 1. Select **Download on-premises agent**, and then select **Accept terms & download**.\n+1. On the left pane, select **Agents**.\n+1. Select **Download on-premises agent**, and then select **Accept terms & download**.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows downloading the agent.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows downloading the agent.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\":::\n \n- 1. After you download the Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent Package, run the *AADConnectProvisioningAgentSetup.exe* installation file from your downloads folder.\n+1. After you download the Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent Package, run the *AADConnectProvisioningAgentSetup.exe* installation file from your downloads folder.\n \n- 1. On the screen that opens, select the **I agree to the license terms and conditions** checkbox, and then select **Install**.\n+1. On the screen that opens, select the **I agree to the license terms and conditions** checkbox, and then select **Install**.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-splash-screen.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Microsoft Entra Provisioning Agent Package screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-2.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/agree-license-terms.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Microsoft Entra Provisioning Agent Package licensing terms.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/agree-license-terms.png\":::\n \n- 1. After the installation finishes, the configuration wizard opens. Select **Next** to start the configuration.\n+1. After the installation finishes, the configuration wizard opens. Select **Next** to start the configuration.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-3.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the welcome screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-3.png\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/welcome.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the welcome screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/welcome.png\":::\n+   \n+1. Sign in with an account with at least the [Hybrid Identity administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#hybrid-identity-administrator) role. If you have Internet Explorer enhanced security enabled, it blocks the sign-in. If so, close the installation, [disable Internet Explorer enhanced security](/troubleshoot/developer/browsers/security-privacy/enhanced-security-configuration-faq), and restart the Microsoft Entra Provisioning Agent Package installation.\n \n- 1. On the **Select Extension** screen, select **HR-driven provisioning (Workday and SuccessFactors) / Azure AD Connect Cloud Sync**, and then select **Next**.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/username.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Connect Microsoft Entra ID screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/username.png\":::\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-5.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Select Extension screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-5.png\":::\n+1. On the **Configure Service Account** screen, select a group Managed Service Account (gMSA). This account is used to run the agent service. If a managed service account is already configured in your domain by another agent and you're installing a second agent, select **Create gMSA**. The system detects the existing account and adds the required permissions for the new agent to use the gMSA account. When you're prompted, choose one of two options:\n \n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > If you install the provisioning agent for use with [Microsoft Entra on-premises application provisioning](~/identity/app-provisioning/on-premises-application-provisioning-architecture.md), select **On-premises application provisioning (Microsoft Entra ID to application)**.\n+   - **Create gMSA**: Let the agent create the **provAgentgMSA$** managed service account for you. The group managed service account (for example, `CONTOSO\\provAgentgMSA$`) is created in the same Active Directory domain where the host server joined. To use this option, enter the Active Directory domain administrator credentials (recommended).\n+   - **Use custom gMSA**: Provide the name of the managed service account that you manually created for this task.\n \n- 1. Sign in with an account with at least the [Hybrid Identity administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#hybrid-identity-administrator) role. If you have Internet Explorer enhanced security enabled, it blocks the sign-in. If so, close the installation, [disable Internet Explorer enhanced security](/troubleshoot/developer/browsers/security-privacy/enhanced-security-configuration-faq), and restart the Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent Package installation.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows how to configure the group Managed Service Account.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\":::\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-azure.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Connect Microsoft Entra ID screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-azure.png\":::\n+1. To continue, select **Next**.\n \n- 1. On the **Configure Service Account** screen, select a group Managed Service Account (gMSA). This account is used to run the agent service. If a managed service account is already configured in your domain by another agent and you're installing a second agent, select **Create gMSA**. The system detects the existing account and adds the required permissions for the new agent to use the gMSA account. When you're prompted, choose one of two options:\n+1. On the **Connect Active Directory** screen, if your domain name appears under **Configured domains**, skip to the next step. Otherwise, enter your Active Directory domain name, and select **Add directory**.\n \n-    - **Create gMSA**: Let the agent create the **provAgentgMSA$** managed service account for you. The group managed service account (for example, `CONTOSO\\provAgentgMSA$`) is created in the same Active Directory domain where the host server joined. To use this option, enter the Active Directory domain administrator credentials (recommended).\n-    - **Use custom gMSA**: Provide the name of the managed service account that you manually created for this task.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows configured domains.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\":::\n \n- 1. To continue, select **Next**.\n+1. Sign in with your Active Directory domain administrator account. The domain administrator account shouldn't have an expired password. If the password is expired or changes during the agent installation, reconfigure the agent with the new credentials. This operation adds your on-premises directory. Select **OK**, and then select **Next** to continue.\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Configure Service Account screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configure-service-account.png\":::\n+1. Select **Next** to continue.\n \n- 1. On the **Connect Active Directory** screen, if your domain name appears under **Configured domains**, skip to the next step. Otherwise, enter your Active Directory domain name, and select **Add directory**.\n+1. On the **Configuration complete** screen, select **Confirm**. This operation registers and restarts the agent.\n \n- 1. Sign in with your Active Directory domain administrator account. The domain administrator account shouldn't have an expired password. If the password is expired or changes during the agent installation, reconfigure the agent with the new credentials. This operation adds your on-premises directory. Select **OK**, and then select **Next** to continue.\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/finish.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the finish screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/finish.png\":::\n \n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-entra.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows how to enter the domain admin credentials.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-sign-in-to-entra.png\":::\n-\n- 1. The following screenshot shows an example of the domain configured for contoso.com. Select **Next** to continue.\n-\n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Connect Active Directory screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-configured-domains.png\":::\n-\n- 1. On the **Configuration complete** screen, select **Confirm**. This operation registers and restarts the agent.\n-\n- 1. After the operation finishes, you see a notification that your agent configuration was successfully verified. Select **Exit**.\n-\n-    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-confirm-screen.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the finish screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/azure-ad-cloud-sync-confirm-screen.png\":::\n-\n- 1. If you still get the initial screen, select **Close**.\n+1. After the operation finishes, you see a notification that your agent configuration was successfully verified. Select **Exit**. If you still get the initial screen, select **Close**."

ai_summary.Response:
The changes include:

*   Clarifying the behaviour of Temporary Access Pass (TAP) for federated domains, specifically when MFA is required and how it interacts with the `FederatedIdpMfaBehavior` setting.
*   Updating the "Deep analysis (Preview)" heading to simply "Deep analysis" in the agent optimization review suggestions documentation.
*   Adding `PayloadIdentifier` keys to the macOS Kerberos configuration for both on-premises Active Directory and Microsoft Entra ID Cloud Kerberos profiles.
*   Adding an entry for Australia to the Amazon Business provisioning tutorial's region-specific URLs.

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates documentation regarding temporary access passes (TAP) for Windows Hello for Business setup. It clarifies that for federated domains, the behaviour of TAP during multi-factor authentication (MFA) is influenced by the `FederatedIdpMfaBehavior` setting. Specifically, if `enforceMfaByFederatedIdp` is enabled, users will be redirected to the federated identity provider for MFA and won't be able to use a TAP. However, with `acceptIfMfaDoneByFederatedIdp`, a TAP prompt will appear in Microsoft Entra ID for MFA during Windows Hello for Business provisioning.

It also analyzes exclusions—flagging policies that exclude a large portion of users and recommending explicit exclusion of break‑glass accounts to reduce the risk of accidental lockout.\n "

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation for Conditional Access agent optimization suggestions. The primary change is the removal of the "(Preview)" tag from the "Deep analysis" section, indicating that this feature is now generally available. The text also clarifies that deep analysis provides a JSON view of policy changes and allows for the download of affected users and applications.

The users are selected within the scope details section of the workflow." }, { "sha": "a0ef5e7b8d12cbc17c522faa80f1321690e9c639", "filename": "docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md", "status": "added", "additions": 50, "deletions": 0, "changes": 50, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-inactive-users.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@\n+---\n+title: Manage inactive users using Lifecycle Workflows (Preview)\n+description: This article walks you through managing inactive users with Lifecycle Workflows.\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.subservice: lifecycle-workflows\n+ms.topic: how-to #Required; leave this attribute/value as-is\n+ms.date: 08/28/2025\n+\n+#CustomerIntent: As an IT administrator, I want to automate managing users with Lifecycle Workflows so that management and security is streamlined.\n+---\n+\n+# Manage inactive users using Lifecycle Workflows (Preview)\n+\n+As part of supporting users no matter where they fall in the Joiner-Mover-Leaver (JML) model of their lifecycle within your organization, Lifecycle Workflows support automating the disabling and deleting of users once they are inactive for a set period of time. This [sign-in inactivity](lifecycle-workflow-execution-conditions.md#sign-in-inactivity-trigger) allows you to set a workflow to run when a user is inactive for a set number of days. This feature allows you to seamlessly maintain a secure environment by automating the removal of inactive based on criteria you set for your organization.\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [Microsoft Entra ID Governance license](~/includes/entra-entra-governance-license.md)]\n+\n+\n+## Manage inactive users using the Microsoft Entra Admin Center\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Lifecycle Workflows Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#lifecycle-workflows-administrator).\n+\n+1. Browse to **ID Governance** > **Lifecycle workflows** > **workflows**.\n+\n+1. On the workflow screen, select the specific workflow you want to add the inactive user task to, or create a new workflow based on a template.\n+ > [!NOTE]\n+ > To use any of the leaver tasks, you must select a leaver workflow template.\n+1. On the **Basics** tab, after entering a unique display name and description for the workflow, select the **Sign-in inactivity** trigger.\n+\n+1. Once you select your desired workflow template enter in basic details, and then select the **Sign-in inactivity** trigger.\n+\n+1. Under the **Days of inactivity**, enter the number of days you want the trigger to run for if exceeded, and then select **Next**.\n+ :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-inactive-users/inactivity-trigger.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of days of inactivity.\":::\n+1. On the **Scope** page, enter the scope you want for the trigger, and then select **Next**.\n+\n+1. On the **Review Tasks** page, select the task you want to run for the users who you consider to be inactive and select **Review + Create**.\n+ > [!NOTE]\n+ > Lifecycle Workflows comes with a built-in task, [Send email about user inactivity (Preview)](lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md#send-email-about-user-inactivity-preview), that is directly related to helping manage inactive users.\n+\n+\n+## Next step\n+\n+- [Manage workflow versions](manage-workflow-tasks.md)\n+- [Manage workflow properties](manage-workflow-properties.md)\n+" }, { "sha": "d3ed6899df0836e30fd7e47310ce10667ac3cc33", "filename": "docs/id-governance/lifecycle-workflow-tasks.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 69, "deletions": 17, "changes": 86, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-tasks.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-tasks.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Flifecycle-workflow-tasks.md?ref=effa88bcc429d9b413365fd1cbe7a0340c2262cc", "patch": "@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ Common task parameters are the non-unique parameters contained in every task. Wh\n |---------|---------|\n |category | A read-only string that identifies the category or categories of the task. Automatically determined when the taskDefinitionID is chosen. |\n |taskDefinitionId | A string referencing a taskDefinition that determines which task to run. |\n-|isEnabled | A boolean value that denotes whether the task is set to run or not. If set to “true\" then the task runs. Defaults to true. |\n+|isEnabled | A boolean value that denotes whether the task is set to run or not. If set to “*true\"* then the task runs. Defaults to true. |\n |displayName | A unique string that identifies the task. |\n |description | A string that describes the purpose of the task for administrative use. (Optional) |\n |executionSequence | A read-only integer that states in what order the task runs in a workflow. |\n@@ -56,10 +56,10 @@ Recipients of the emails can be:\n > [!NOTE]\n > Additional CC recipients are only available if the recipient is the user themselves or their manager. If there are multiple CC recipients, they're copied on the single individual email. \n \n-Under **Email Customization** you're able to customize the specific email message send out by the task. If you choose to customize the email, you're able to set the following arguments:\n+Under **Email Customization** you're able to customize the specific email message sent out by the task. If you choose to customize the email, you're able to set the following arguments:\n \n - **Subject**: Customizes the subject of emails.\n-- **Message body**: Customizes the body of the emails being sent out.\n+- **Message body**: Customizes the body of the emails being sent out and can be further customized using [HTML elements](customize-workflow-email.md#customize-email-text).\n - **Email language translation**: Overrides the email recipient's language settings. Custom text isn't customized, and it's recommended to set this language to the same language as the custom text. \n \n :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/lifecycle-workflow-task/customize-email-concept.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the customization email options.\":::\n@@ -205,7 +205,7 @@ Example of usage within the workflow:\n Microsoft Entra allows you to use a [Temporary Access Pass (TAP)](..//identity/authentication/howto-authentication-temporary-access-pass.md) to set up password-less credentials for users. You can also use [Microsoft Entra self-service password reset](../identity/authentication/concept-sspr-howitworks.md) to set a regular password. Keychain to Apple's Secure Enclave for storing device identity keys. Starting August 2025, the Secure Storage rollout will make Secure Enclave the default key storage for all new device registrations. New device registrations will use secure storage model by default. Existing devices that do not support Secure Enclave will have registration keys stored in the user's iCloud Keychain instead of the Login Keychain, which provides stronger protection than legacy Login Keychain storage. Existing functionality for older devices remains the same.\n+In March 2024, Microsoft announced that Microsoft Entra ID will transition from Apple's Keychain to Apple's Secure Enclave for storing device identity keys. Beginning August 2025, the Secure Storage rollout will make Secure Enclave the default key storage for all new device registrations. New device registrations will use the secure storage model by default. Existing devices that do not support Secure Enclave will have registration keys stored in the user's Keychain (but not in the legacy Login Keychain). ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces significant updates to the Microsoft Entra ID Governance documentation, primarily focusing on Lifecycle Workflows. Key changes include the addition of a new feature to manage inactive users, a new trigger based on sign-in activity, and enhancements to email customization within workflows. Furthermore, the documentation has been updated to reflect new workflow templates related to inactive users and adjustments to the device identity key storage process for Apple devices, alongside minor corrections in API examples and permission references.

ai_summary.Response: The commit updates documentation regarding Microsoft Entra ID's transition of device identity key storage from Apple's Keychain to Apple's Secure Enclave. Starting August 2025, new device registrations will default to Secure Enclave. Existing devices not supporting Secure Enclave will store keys in the user's Keychain, not the legacy Login Keychain. Tenants can temporarily opt out of this rollout for up to six months by contacting Microsoft support.

    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: kenwith\n ms.author: kenwith\n manager: dougeby\n ms.topic: overview\n-ms.date: 04/30/2025\n+ms.date: 09/19/2025\n ms.service: global-secure-access\n ms.custom: references_regions\n ai-usage: ai-assisted\n@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ Microsoft Entra Internet Access and Microsoft Entra Private Access comprise Micr\n \n Microsoft Entra Internet Access and Microsoft Entra Private Access - coupled with Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps, our SaaS-security focused Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) - are uniquely built as a solution that converges network, identity, and endpoint access controls so you can secure access to any app or resource, from anywhere. With the addition of these Global Secure Access products, Microsoft Entra ID simplifies access policy management and enables access orchestration for employees, business partners, and digital workloads. You can continuously monitor and adjust user access in real time if permissions or risk level changes.\n \n-The Global Secure Access features streamline the roll-out and management of the access control capabilities with a unified portal. These features are delivered from Microsoft's Wide Area Network, spanning 140+ regions and 190+ network edge locations. This private network, which is one of the largest in the world, enables organizations to optimally connect users and devices to public and private resources seamlessly and securely. For a list of the current points of presence, see [Global Secure Access points of presence article](reference-points-of-presence.md).\n+The Global Secure Access features streamline the roll-out and management of the access control capabilities with a unified portal. These features are delivered from Microsoft's Wide Area Network, spanning 70 regions and 190+ network edge locations. This private network, which is one of the largest in the world, enables organizations to optimally connect users and devices to public and private resources seamlessly and securely. For a list of the current points of presence, see [Global Secure Access points of presence article](reference-points-of-presence.md).\n \n ## Microsoft Entra Internet Access\n "

ai_summary.Response:
The changes update documentation for Microsoft Entra Global Secure Access.

*   The disclaimer for the TLS inspection feature has been refined to provide clearer guidance for preview users, particularly regarding production environments.
*   The number of regions for Microsoft's Wide Area Network has been updated from 140+ to 70.
*   Minor improvements have been made to PowerShell script output messages for clarity.

It refines the output messages for clarity and corrects an oversight where the SDK cmdlet for uploading the signed certificate was commented out, preventing its execution. When a connector is running, it remains active as it connects to the service. Unused connectors are tagged as `_inactive_` and are removed after 10 days of inactivity. If you do want to uninstall a connector, though, uninstall both the Connector service and the Updater service from the server. Restart the computer to fully remove the service.\n \n+## Handling Connector Server Issues\n+If one or more connector servers become unavailable (e.g., due to a server outage, network outage, or similar issue), follow these steps to maintain service continuity:\n+ \n+1.\tIdentify and remove the affected (“bad”) servers from the connector group.\n+2.\tAdd available healthy servers (“good”) or backup servers into the connector group to restore capacity.\n+3.\tReboot affected servers to drain any pre-existing connections. Existing ongoing connections don’t drain immediately with connector group changes.\n+ \n+This sequence is the recommended approach to ensure service stability and minimize disruption when connector servers encounter issues.\n+\n ## Connector updates\n \n Microsoft Entra ID occasionally provides automatic updates for all the connectors that you deploy. As long as the private network connector updater service is running, your connectors may update with the latest major connector release automatically. If you don’t see the Connector Updater service on your server, you need to reinstall your connector to get updates."

    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@\n+---\n+title: Configure Requestor Visibility of Approver Details (Preview)\n+description: Learn how to configure whether requestors can see approver details for pending access package requests in the My Access portal at the tenant or package level.\n+author: OWinfreyATL\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 08/20/2025\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+ms.reviewer: owinfrey\n+---\n+\n+# Configure whether requestors can see approver details (Preview)\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> This feature will be widely available beginning in September 2025.\n+\n+Admins can control whether requestors see approver details for pending access package requests in the [My Access](https://myaccess.microsoft.com) portal. You can set this option at the access package level, or at the tenant level (default for all packages). The access package setting overrides the tenant setting when explicitly set to Yes or No.\n+\n+## Tenant-level setting (applies to all access packages by default)\n+\n+Use this setting to define the default behavior for all access packages in your tenant. This setting applies to **members only** and can be overridden by the access package-level setting.\n+\n+1. In the Microsoft Entra admin center, go to **Identity Governance** > **Entitlement management** > **Control configurations**.\n+\n+2. Under **My Access settings for end users**, find **Show approver details to members on pending access package requests (preview).**\n+\n+3. Choose the desired behavior:\n+\n+   - **Checked** – All members (excluding guests) will see their approver’s name and email address on pending access package requests in My Access.\n+\n+   - **Unchecked** – Members won’t see approver details by default.\n+\n+4. Select **Save**.\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> - The tenant setting applies to all access packages by default but can be overridden on a per-package basis via Advanced request settings.\n+> - To show approver details to guests and connected organization users, set the access package-level setting to Yes.\n+\n+\n+\n+## Next step\n+\n+> [!div class=\"nextstepaction\"]\n+> [What are access reviews? - Microsoft Entra](access-reviews-overview.md)\n+> [What is the My Access portal?](my-access-portal-overview.md)\n\\ No newline at end of file"
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces several updates to Microsoft Entra documentation. New guidance on handling connector server issues is added to the concept connectors documentation. The FAQ for transport layer security now specifies supported cryptographic algorithms. The minimum Windows Server version for the Entra private network connector has been updated to 2016. Finally, new documentation has been added regarding the configuration of requestor visibility of approver details in the My Access portal for entitlement management.

New connectors won't support OAuth Authorization code grant, and existing connectors should now use the OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant. \n \n-- **Authorization URL**, a URL by the client to obtain authorization from the resource owner via user-agent redirection. The user is redirected to this URL to authorize access. \n-\n-- **Token exchange URL**, a URL by the client to exchange an authorization grant for an access token, typically with client authentication.\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> It's not recommended to leave the token field blank in the Microsoft Entra provisioning configuration custom app UI. The token generated is primarily available for testing purposes.\n \n-- **Client ID**, the authorization server issues the registered client a client identifier, which is a unique string representing the registration information provided by the client.  The client identifier isn't a secret; it's exposed to the resource owner and **must not** be used alone for client authentication.  \n+For more authentication and authorization methods, let us know on [UserVoice](https://aka.ms/appprovisioningfeaturerequest).\n \n-- **Client secret**, a secret generated by the authorization server that should be a unique value known only to the authorization server. \n+### OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant flow\n \n-> [!NOTE]\n-> The **Authorization URL** and **Token exchange URL** are currently not configurable per tenant.\n+The provisioning service supports the OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant. After submitting your request for publishing your app in the gallery, our team will work with you to collect the following information:\n \n-> [!NOTE]\n-> OAuth v1 is not supported due to exposure of the client secret. OAuth v2 is supported.  \n+- **Tenant URL:** This is the SCIM API endpoint URL provided by your service provider. For example, it could be something like https://example.test/scim.\n+- **Token Endpoint:** This is the OAuth2 Token URL. It's the endpoint that the provisioning service will use to exchange client credentials for an access token. For example, it could be something like https://example.test/oauth2/token.\n+- **Client Identifier:** This is a unique identifier assigned to your application by the service provider.\n+- **Client Secret:** This is a long-lived token that has the necessary permissions on the API. It's used to authenticate your application when requesting an access token.\n \n-When using the OAuth Code Grant flow, it's required that you support a model where each customer will submit their own client ID and Client Secret when setting up a provisioning instance. A single app wide client ID/Client Secret pair is not supported.\n \n+When using the OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant flow, it's required that you support a model where each customer will submit their own client ID and Client Secret when setting up a provisioning instance. A single app wide client ID/Client Secret pair is not supported.\n \n-#### How to set up OAuth code grant flow\n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator).\n-1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Enterprise apps** > **Application** > **Provisioning** and select **Authorize**.\n \n+#### How to set up client credentials\n 1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator).\n 1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Enterprise apps**.\n 1. Select your application and go to **Provisioning**.\n-1. Select **Authorize**.\n-\n-   1. Users are redirected to the Authorization URL (sign in page for the third party app).\n-\n-   1. Admin provides credentials to the third party application. \n-\n-   1. The third party app redirects user back and provides the grant code \n-\n-   1. The Provisioning Service calls the token URL and provides the grant code. The third party application responds with the access token, refresh token, and expiry date\n-\n-1. When the provisioning cycle begins, the service checks if the current access token is valid and exchanges it for a new token if needed. The access token is provided in each request made to the app and the validity of the request is checked before each request.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> While it's not possible to set up OAuth on the non-gallery applications, you can manually generate an access token from your authorization server and input it as the secret token to a non-gallery application. This allows you to verify compatibility of your SCIM server with the Microsoft Entra provisioning service before onboarding to the app gallery, which does support the OAuth code grant.  \n-\n-**Long-lived OAuth bearer tokens:** If your application doesn't support the OAuth authorization code grant flow, instead generate a long lived OAuth bearer token that an administrator can use to set up the provisioning integration. The token should be perpetual, or else the provisioning job is [quarantined](application-provisioning-quarantine-status.md) when the token expires.\n+1. For **Admin Credentials > Authentication Method**, select **OAuth2 Client Credentials Grant**.\n+1. Enter your information for the remaining fields:\n+    - **Tenant URL**\n+    - **Token Endpoint**\n+    - **Client Identifier**\n+    - **Client Secret**.\n+1. Click **Test Connection**.\n \n For more authentication and authorization methods, let us know on [UserVoice](https://aka.ms/appprovisioningfeaturerequest).\n "

ai_summary.Response:
This commit primarily addresses documentation updates for Microsoft Entra ID.

Key changes include:

*   The minimum .NET version required for Microsoft Entra private network connectors has been updated from v4.7.1+ to v4.7.2+.
*   A port correction has been made in the documentation for using Azure SQL Service Endpoints with Global Secure Access, changing the port from `1443` to `1433`.
*   Significant updates have been made to the documentation regarding SCIM provisioning, particularly concerning authentication and authorisation methods. The OAuth Authorization Code Grant is being deprecated in favour of the OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant for new connectors, and guidance on setting up the client credentials flow has been enhanced.

However, since Windows Server 2016 is in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration.\n+- Microsoft Entra Connect must be installed on a domain-joined Windows Server 2016-2022. However, since Windows Server 2016 is in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration. Installing on unsupported Windows Server version may cause service failures or unexpected behavior.\n - The minimum .NET Framework version required is 4.6.2, and newer versions of .NET are also supported.  .NET version 4.8 and greater offers the best accessibility compliance.\n - Microsoft Entra Connect can't be installed on Small Business Server or Windows Server Essentials before 2019 (Windows Server Essentials 2019 is supported). The server must be using Windows Server standard or better. \n - The Microsoft Entra Connect server must have a full GUI installed. Installing Microsoft Entra Connect on Windows Server Core isn't supported. "
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the prerequisites documentation for installing Microsoft Entra Connect. The update clarifies that the software can be installed on Windows Server 2016 through 2022, with a recommendation for Windows Server 2022. It also adds a cautionary note about potential service failures if installed on unsupported Windows Server versions.
